WARNING: Had an issue with Power Shortcuts icons/names turning generic repeatedly. Contacted dev, he says Power Shortcuts doesn't work properly with Nova Launcher, a launcher known as friendly with 3rd party icons. Dev doesn't warn of Nova Launcher incompatibility before purchase. Don't purchase if you use Nova Launcher. RESPONSE: Only occurs with Power Shortcuts, I've never had issue with any other shortcuts or icons, so Power Shortcuts is assigning icon/name incorrectly somehow apparently.
replyContent: As I said in the mail, the icon and label of shortcuts are saved in the launcher side and Nova lost it in your case. It's a bug of the launcher.

Everytime I turn on Android's power saving mode, it says "Power shortcuts must be enabled in accessability services" when I try using it. To solve it I have to clear app data and enable it again. That's my only complaint with the app. Otherwise, it's a very good app. Thank you developers.
replyContent: Try to disable the battery saver option for the app in the system settings. Thanks.

content: Edit: hi thank you for your response. Yeah, I select the My Files app on the left panel and when I go to repeat for a second shortcut I still have to do it. It still doesn't remember the app I chose. This is by no means a deal breaker but would be a great addition to save time by already having the left panel app opened up and remembered after being selected just once
replyContent: When you select a content file, try to select the proper app on the left menu panel of the content selection screen first. And then you can navigate and pick a content on the app UI. Thanks.
